data.chText: （衣服、发式等的）流行款式，时兴式样
data.enText: a popular style of clothes, hair, etc. at a particular time or place; the state of being popular
dressed in the latest fashion
the new season's fashions
Long skirts have come into fashion again.
Jeans are still in fashion .

data.chText: 有些款式永远不会过时。
data.enText: Some styles never go out of fashion .
a popular way of behaving, doing an activity, etc.

data.chText: 那时教学时兴的主要是书面语。
data.enText: The fashion at the time was for teaching mainly the written language.

data.chText: 文艺的潮流总是昙花一现。
data.enText: Fashions in art and literature come and go.
the business of making or selling clothes in new and different styles

data.chText: 时装设计师 / 杂志 / 表演
data.enText: a fashion designer/magazine/show
the world of fashion
the fashion industry
after a fashion
to some extent, but not very well

data.chText: 我会弹钢琴，不过马马虎虎。
data.enText: I can play the piano, after a fashion.
after the fashion of sb/sth
in the style of sb/sth

data.chText: 这座新图书馆很像纳什的风格。
data.enText: The new library is very much after the fashion of Nash.
in (a)… fashion
in a particular way

data.chText: 他们的态度怎么会这样呢？
data.enText: How could they behave in such a fashion?

data.chText: 整个部门的人都辞了职，戏剧性地证明她是对的。
data.enText: She was proved right, in dramatic fashion, when the whole department resigned.
like it's going out of fashion

data.chText: 做得很多；大量使用；大肆花费
data.enText: used to emphasize that sb is doing sth or using sth a lot
She's been spending money like it's going out of fashion.

data.chText: （尤指用手工）制作，使成形，塑造
data.enText: to make or shape sth, especially with your hands
She fashioned a pot from the clay.
She fashioned the clay into a pot.

ex.enText: His shoes were out of fashion.
Long and curly hair is in fashion again this year.

synonyms.bx: 指某一时期服装、发型等的时兴式样。

ex.chText: 她总是很了解服装的最新流行款式。
ex.enText: She always understands well the newest mode in dresses.

synonyms.bx: 指文学、艺术等的风格或服装等的式样。

ex.chText: 这些房间是以传统风格装修的。
ex.enText: The rooms are decorated in the traditional style.

ex.chText: 过去10年里，汽车款式在全球范围内变化很大。
ex.enText: Car styles around the whole world have changed a lot in the past decade.
Long skirts are out of style.

synonyms.bx: 指服装、发型、家具等的设计款式，也可指流行的式样。

data.enText: after a fashion
to some extent, but not very well

data.chText: 我会弹钢琴，不过马马虎虎。
data.enText: I can play the piano, after a fashion.
after the fashion of sb/sth
in the style of sb/sth

data.chText: 这座新图书馆很像纳什的风格。
data.enText: The new library is very much after the fashion of Nash.
in (a)… fashion
in a particular way

data.chText: 他们的态度怎么会这样呢？
data.enText: How could they behave in such a fashion?

data.chText: 整个部门的人都辞了职，戏剧性地证明她是对的。
data.enText: She was proved right, in dramatic fashion, when the whole department resigned.
like it's going out of fashion

data.chText: 做得很多；大量使用；大肆花费
data.enText: used to emphasize that sb is doing sth or using sth a lot
She's been spending money like it's going out of fashion.

tr: consumer goods (especially clothing) in the current mode
how something is done or how it happens
example: in the characteristic New York style

tr: the latest and most admired style in clothes and cosmetics and behavior
make out of components (often in an improvising manner)
example: She fashioned a tent out of a sheet and a few sticks

value.def: Fashion is the area of activity that involves styles of clothing and appearance.

example.ex: There are 20 full-colour pages of fashion for men...
example.tran: 书中有 20 张有关男性时尚的彩色插页。

example.ex: The fashion world does not mind what the real world thinks.
example.tran: 时尚界并不在意现实世界的想法。

value.def: A fashion is a style of clothing or a way of behaving that is popular at a particular time.

example.ex: In the early seventies I wore false eyelashes, as was the fashion...
example.tran: 70 年代初我戴假睫毛，这在当时是时尚。

example.ex: Queen Mary started the fashion for blue and white china in England...
example.tran: 玛丽女王开启了青花瓷在英格兰的流行风尚。

example.ex: He stayed at the top through all changes and fashions in pop music.
example.tran: 在流行音乐的各种变化和各式潮流中他一直处于前沿。

value.def: If you do something in a particular fashion or after a particular fashion, you do it in that way.

example.ex: There is another drug called DHE that works in a similar fashion...
example.tran: 另外还有一种叫 DHE 的药物，药效也差不多。

example.ex: It is happening in this fashion because of the obstinacy of one woman.
example.tran: 事情会如此发展是因为一个女人的固执己见。

value.def: If you fashion an object or a work of art, you make it.

example.ex: Stone Age settlers fashioned necklaces from sheep's teeth.
example.tran: 石器时代的移居者用羊的牙做成项链。

value.def: If you say that something was done after a fashion, you mean that it was done, but not very well.

example.ex: She was educated — after a fashion — at home...
example.tran: 她算得上是受过教育——家庭教育。

example.ex: He knew the way, after a fashion.

value.def: If something is in fashion, it is popular and approved of at a particular time. If it is out of fashion, it is not popular or approved of.

example.ex: That sort of house is back in fashion...
example.tran: 那种房子又时兴起来了。

example.ex: Marriage seems to be going out of fashion.

trans: 服装设计专业；流行设计；时装设计；服装设计；时尚设计
时尚配件；服装配件；时尚配饰；时尚饰品；流行配件

流行色；时尚色彩；风行色
老派；过时的；古老品系；古典鸡尾酒；古典
用这种方式；以这种方式；照这样
时尚宣言(为引人注目而穿戴或拥有的奇装异服)
勉强；马马虎虎,勉强；马马虎虎
流行；成为时尚；也许有一天会流行起来；流行起来；开始时新
